content.text: On the Venn diagram below, shade the region which represents \((A \cap B') \cup (C \cap B')\)
Complete the Venn diagram below to show the sets \(Y\) and \(Z\) such that \(Z \subset X \subset Y\)
the amplitude of \(y\),
the period of \(y\)
Given that \(y = 3 + 4\cos 9x\), write down
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = 3\sin x - 2\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant \theta \leqslant 360^{\circ}\)
Given that \(0\leqslant |3\sin x - 2|\leqslant k\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant x\leqslant 360^{\circ}\), write down the value of \(k\)
the area of triangle \(ABC\),
tan \(ABC\), giving your answer in the form \(\frac{a + b\sqrt{5}}{c}\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are positive integers.
In this question, all dimensions are in centimetres

The diagram shows an isosceles triangle \(ABC\), where \(AB = AC\). The point \(M\) is the mid-point of \(BC\). Given that \(AM = 3 + 2\sqrt{5}\) and \(BC = 4 + 6\sqrt{5}\), find, **without using a calculator**,
The normal to the curve \(y = \sqrt{4x + 9}\) , at the point where \(x = 4\) , meets the \(x\)- and \(y\)-axes at the points \(A\) and \(B\). Find the coordinates of the mid-point of the line \(AB\)
\(\mathbf{A} + 3\mathbf{C}\),
BA

Given that \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 & 1 \\ 2 & 4 \end{pmatrix}, \mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 5 & 1 \\ 2 & 4 \\ - 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{C} = \begin{pmatrix} - 5 & 2 \\ 3 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\), find
Given that \(\mathbf{X} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & - 3 \\ 4 & - 2 \end{pmatrix}\), find \(\mathbf{X}^{- 1}\)
Hence find \(\mathbf{Y}\), such that \(\mathbf{X}\mathbf{Y} = \begin{pmatrix} 5 & - 10 \\ 15 & 20 \end{pmatrix}\)
Show that \(\frac{\tan^{2}\theta + \sin^{2}\theta}{\cos\theta + \sec\theta} = \tan\theta \sin\theta .\)
Given that \(x = 3 \sin \phi\) and \(y = \frac{3}{\cos \phi}\) , find the numerical value of \(9y^2 - x^2 y^2\)
Find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\)
Using your values of \(a\) and \(b\), write \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) in the form \((2x + 1)\mathrm{q}(x)\), where \(\mathrm{q}(x)\) is a quadratic expression
Hence find the exact solutions of the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\)

It is given that \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 2x^{3} + ax^{2} + 4x + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. It is given also that \(2x + 1\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) and that when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x - 1\) there is a remainder of \(-12\)
Show that \(\mathrm{e}^{5k} - \mathrm{e}^{-5k} = 3.\)
Hence, using the substitution \(y = \mathrm{e}^{5k}\), or otherwise, find the value of \(k\)
It is given that \(\int_{-k}^{k}(15\mathrm{e}^{5x} - 5\mathrm{e}^{-5x})\mathrm{d}x = 6.\)
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\)
Hence show that \(\int \ln (5x + 1)\mathrm{d}x = \frac{(ax + b)}{5}\ln (5x + 1) - x + c\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers and \(c\) is a constant of integration
Hence find \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{5}} \ln (5x + 1) \mathrm{d}x\), giving your answer in the form \(\frac{d + \ln f}{5}\), where \(d\) and \(f\) are integers.
It is given that \(y = (10x + 2)\ln (5x + 1)\)
Find the coordinates of the stationary point of the curve
Determine the nature of this stationary point
Find the approximate change in \(y\) when \(x\) increases from 4 to \(4 + h\), where \(h\) is small
A curve has equation \(y = 6x - x\sqrt{x}\)
Find the acceleration of the particle at time \(t\)
Hence find the smallest value of \(t\) for which the acceleration of the particle is zero
Find the displacement, \(x\) m from \(O\), of the particle at time \(t\)
A particle moves in a straight line, such that its velocity, \(v \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) , \(t \mathrm{~s}\) after passing a fixed point \(O\), is given by \(v = 2 + 6t + 3 \sin 2t\)
